title: About
text:
This event is hosted by the Pathology Student Interest Group.
Find more information on this group at https://linktr.ee/virtualpathsig.
This page was created by Samir Nacer and Trey Saddler.

title: Ahmed Afifi

title: Ahmed Afifi
text:
Fun Fact(s)
I have a passion for medical illustration, graphic design, photography, and digital painting. In my free time, I enjoy playing table tennis, running, chess, and swimming.

title: Ahmed Afifi
text:
Favorite Cell Type
My favorite cell is the Kupffer cell.

title: Samir Nacer

Fun Fact(s)
I met my fianc√©e while visiting Argentina üá¶üá∑ . She is from Brazil üáßüá∑ originally. We both share a passion for medicine and enjoy sharing our paths with each other. Also we were there during the World Cup! ‚öΩÔ∏è

title: Samir Nacer
text:
Favorite Cell Type
When it comes to my favorite cell type, there is nothing that captures my imagination more than neurons and their connectivity. I am particularly fascinated with immunohistochemistry. NeuN is my preferred option, as it is great for visualizing neuronal differentiation.

title: PathSIG Presents: #PathMatch24 PD Panel
text:
Sep 2, 2023 02:00 PM EST
Here is the Zoom link to register for the event:





If you would like to have a question answered by Pathology Directors on the panel, please follow this link and submit your question on Google Forms. Please submit a new sheet for each question that you would like to ask.

title: Allegheny Health Network Medical Education Consortium (AGH)
text: Joseph A. DelTondo, DO is the Program Director at Allegheny Health Network Medical Education Consortium (AGH), located in Pittsburgh, PA.

title: Allegheny Health Network Medical Education Consortium (AGH)
text:
Director Information

Dr.¬†Joseph A. DelTondo, DO
- Position: Pathologist
- Location: Hershey, Pennsylvania
- Affiliation:
- Allegheny General Hospital
- West Virginia University Hospitals
- Education:
- Medical Degree: Lake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine - Seton Hill
- Experience: In practice between 11-20 years.
- Specialties:
- Pathology: Pathologists diagnose and characterize diseases by analyzing biopsied tissue or bodily fluids and interpreting medical tests, including tests done by other specialists.
- Subspecialties:
- Cytopathology
- Forensic/Autopsy
- Anatomic Pathology
- Clinical Pathology
Dr.¬†Joseph A. DelTondo is a pathologist based in Hershey, Pennsylvania. He is affiliated with multiple hospitals, including Allegheny General Hospital and West Virginia University Hospitals. Dr.¬†DelTondo specializes in pathology with subspecialties in cytopathology, forensic/autopsy, anatomic pathology, and clinical pathology. He has been practicing for a duration of 11 to 20 years.

title: Allegheny Health Network Medical Education Consortium (AGH)
text:

title: Cleveland Clinic Foundation Program
text: Deborah Chute, MD is the Program Director at Cleveland Clinic Foundation Program, located in Cleveland, OH.

title: Cleveland Clinic Foundation Program
text:
Director Information

Dr.¬†Deborah Chute, MD
- Position:
- Program Director, Anatomic and Clinical Pathology Residency Program
- Staff Pathologist
- Associate Professor of Pathology
- Affiliation: Cleveland Clinic, Department of Anatomic Pathology
- Primary Location: Cleveland Clinic Main Campus, Cleveland, OH
- Education & Training:
- Fellowship: Cytopathology, University of Virginia Medical Center, Charlottesville, VA (2009)
- Fellowship: Surgical Pathology, Stanford University Hospital, Stanford, CA (2008)
- Residency: AP/CP Pathology, University of Virginia Medical Center, Charlottesville, VA (2007)
- Medical Education: MD, University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine, Philadelphia, PA (2003)
- Undergraduate: Biology, John Carroll University, University Heights, OH (1998)
- Certifications:
- Pathology - Anatomic & Clinical Pathology
- Pathology - Cytopathology
- Specialty Interests:
- Cytopathology
- Head and Neck and Endocrine pathology
- Contact:
- Phone: 216.444.0291
- Location: Cleveland Clinic Main Campus, 9500 Euclid Avenue, Cleveland, OH 44195
Dr.¬†Deborah Chute is the Program Director for the Anatomic and Clinical Pathology Residency Program at Cleveland Clinic. She is also a Staff Pathologist and an Associate Professor of Pathology. Dr.¬†Chute has specialized interests in cytopathology, head and neck, and endocrine pathology. She has been affiliated with the Cleveland Clinic and has made significant contributions to the field of pathology.

title: George Washington University
text: Tapan Bhavsar, MD, PhD is the Program Director at George Washington University, located in Washington, DC.

title: George Washington University
text:
Director Information

Dr.¬†Tapan M. Bhavsar, MD, PhD
- Position:
- Chief, Hematopathology Services
- Assistant Professor of Pathology
- Affiliation: George Washington University (GW), Department of Pathology
- Education:
- Medical College: Government Medical College, Surat, South Gujarat Univ., India
- PhD: Toxicology, St.¬†John‚Äôs Univ., Jamaica, NY
- Residency: Temple Univ. Hospital - Anatomic and Clinical Pathology
- Fellowships:
- Hospital of Univ. of Penn - Surgical Pathology
- Laboratory of Pathology, National Cancer Institute, NIH - Hematopathology
- Clinical/Research Interests:
- Anatomic Pathology
- Clinical Pathology
- Hematology
- Genomic and immunohistochemical changes of discordant extramedullary plasmablastic transformation of multiple myeloma
- Immunosuppression-related lymphoproliferative disorders
- Aggressive and indolent B-cell lymphomas, focusing on pediatric marginal zone lymphoma and marginal zone hyperplasia
- KSHV/EBV-associated germinotropic lymphoproliferative disorder
- Location: GW Hospital - Pathology, 900 23rd Street NW Basement Level, Washington, DC 20037
- Contact: 202-715-4665, Email
Dr.¬†Tapan M. Bhavsar is the Chief of Hematopathology Services and an Assistant Professor of Pathology at George Washington University. He specializes in hematopathology and surgical pathology. Dr.¬†Bhavsar‚Äôs research interests include genomic and immunohistochemical changes in various hematological conditions. Before joining GW, he served as an assistant professor and director of flow cytometry at Wayne State University School of Medicine/Detroit Medical Center.

Dr.¬†Shanaah specializes in pathology and has subspecialties in general pathology, blood banking & transfusion medicine, and hematopathology. She has garnered over two decades of experience in his field and has been affiliated with multiple hospitals in the Columbus area.

title: UC Davis Health
text: Kurt Schaberg, MD is the Program Director at UC Davis Health, located in Sacramento, CA.

title: UC Davis Health
text:
Director Information

Kurt Schaberg, M.D.
- Position: Pathology Residency Program Director, Associate Health Sciences Clinical Professor
- Affiliation: UC Davis Health, Department of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine
- Specialties:
- Pathology - Gastrointestinal
- Cytopathology
- Location: 4400 V St., Sacramento, CA 95817
- Education: Medical Degree
- Clinical Interests: Dr.¬†Schaberg is an anatomic pathologist with specialized training in surgical pathology of the gastrointestinal tract. He practices general cytopathology and performs ultrasound-guided fine needle aspirations. He has a clinical interest in inflammatory diseases of the gastrointestinal tract, notably ulcerative colitis and Crohn‚Äôs disease.
- Research/Academic Interests: Dr.¬†Schaberg‚Äôs research centers on gastrointestinal surgical pathology and cytopathology, especially of the liver and pancreas. He has a keen interest in inflammatory diseases of the gastrointestinal tract, including ulcerative colitis and Crohn‚Äôs disease, and education.
Dr.¬†Kurt Schaberg is associated with the UC Davis Comprehensive Cancer Center and the Department of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine at UC Davis Health. He holds the position of Pathology Residency Program Director and serves as an Associate Health Sciences Clinical Professor.

title: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS) College of Medicine Program
text: Susanne Jeffus, MD is the Program Director at University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS) College of Medicine Program, located in Little Rock, AR.

title: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS) College of Medicine Program
text:
Director Information

Susanne Jeffus, M.D.
- Position: Associate Professor, Department of Pathology, University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences (UAMS)
- Education:
- Medical Degree: UAMS
- Residency: Anatomic and Clinical Pathology, UVA, Charlottesville, Virginia (served as chief resident)
- Fellowships: Blood banking & transfusion medicine and cytopathology, UVA
- Clinical Responsibilities: Surgical Pathology (Thoracic & Gynecologic Pathology) and Cytopathology. She is the section chief of the Thoracic Pathology Service.
- Teaching: Dr.¬†Jeffus has a strong inclination towards teaching residents and has been recognized with multiple residency teaching awards.
- Research Interests: Endobronchial ultrasound guided fine needle aspiration cytology of thoracic lesions and vulvar neoplasia. She has contributed to several peer-reviewed publications and textbook chapters.
- Additional Roles: Dr.¬†Jeffus is deeply involved in the Residency Program at UAMS and currently holds the position of Director.
Dr.¬†Susanne Jeffus joined UAMS as faculty in 2013 and has since been an integral part of the department, both in clinical and academic capacities. She is affiliated with the UAMS Medical Center and is a board-certified pathologist.

title: University of California (San Diego) Medical Center

Grace Y. Lin, MD, PhD

- Experience: Dr.¬†Lin‚Äôs research has focused on the V protein of the paramyxovirus simian virus 5. title: University of California (San Francisco)
text: Ronald Balassanian, MD (AP) is the Program Director at University of California (San Francisco), located in San Francisco, CA.

title: University of California (San Francisco)
text:
Director Information

Dr.¬†Ronald Balassanian, MD
- Position: Pathologist at the UCSF Fine Needle Aspiration (FNA) Biopsy Clinic
- Affiliation: Bakar Precision Cancer Medicine Building at Mission Bay, UCSF Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Cancer Center
- Research Interests: Dr.¬†Balassanian‚Äôs research focuses on minimally invasive diagnosis through FNA biopsy. He investigates the use of molecular diagnostics to enhance the value of FNA biopsy. Additionally, he delves into breast cancer diagnosis via FNA biopsy and surgical pathology. He is actively involved in the I-SPY research trials, aiming to expedite the availability of improved, personalized treatments. He also participates in the Athena Breast Health Network, which facilitates learning from a vast patient base across UC medical centers. Furthermore, he leads a project titled ‚ÄúAsk Your Pathologist‚Äù to enhance communication between pathologists and breast cancer patients.
- Education: Dr.¬†Balassanian earned his medical degree from the University of Vermont Larner College of Medicine. He underwent residency training in pathology and laboratory medicine at UCSF, followed by fellowships in surgical pathology and cytopathology.
- Memberships: He is a fellow of the College of American Pathologists and a member of several professional organizations, including the United States and Canadian Academy of Pathology, American Society for Clinical Pathology, American Society of Cytopathology, and Papanicolaou Society of Cytopathology. He also contributes to the UCSF Global Cancer Program, engaging in teaching and research projects on breast FNA biopsy in Peru and Tanzania.

Dr.¬†Watkins has held positions at esteemed institutions such as Harvard Medical School, Massachusetts General Hospital, Vanderbilt University Medical Center, and Brigham and Women‚Äôs Hospital.

title: University of New Mexico School of Medicine Program
text: Evelyn Lockhart, MD is the Program Director at University of New Mexico School of Medicine Program, located in Albuquerque, NM.

title: University of New Mexico School of Medicine Program
text:
Director Information

Dr.¬†Evelyn Lockhart, MD, MScBMC
- Position:
- Professor, Department of Pathology
- Pathology Residency Program Director
- Affiliation: University of New Mexico School of Medicine, Department of Pathology
- Education:
- B.S. in Biology: Virginia Tech
- MD: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
- Residency: Anatomic and Clinical Pathology, Duke University
- Fellowships: Transfusion Medicine, Puget Sound Blood Center/University of Washington
- MScBMC: Biomedical Communication, University of Toronto
- Personal Statement:
Dr.¬†Lockhart‚Äôs primary clinical and research interest is in maternal-fetal transfusion medicine and women with hemostatic disorders, especially patient blood management in women experiencing obstetric hemorrhage. She also has a significant educational interest in visual communication for medical education. Her master‚Äôs thesis project at the University of Toronto explored the use of the Animation Processing Model for developing didactic animations for medical students.
- Areas of Specialty:
- Transfusion Medicine
- Hemostasis
- Medical Education
- Medical Illustration
- Animation
- Achievements & Awards:
- Fellowships in Transfusion Medicine Research and Clinical at Puget Sound Blood Center, Seattle, WA.
- Certificates in Drawing Nature, Science, and Culture: Natural History Illustration 101 from the University of Newcastle Australia.
- Multiple professional recognitions and honors, including the Bernard F. Fetter teaching Award from the Dept. of Pathology, Duke School of Medicine, and the Strength, Hope, and Caring Annual Physician Leadership award from Duke University Hospital.
- Contact Information:
- Phone: (505) 272-3804
- Mailing Address: Faculty Office, UNMH, Bldg 235, 1 University of New Mexico, MSC08 4640, Albuquerque, NM 87131-0001
Dr.¬†Evelyn Lockhart is a Professor in the Department of Pathology at the University of New Mexico School of Medicine. She serves as the Pathology Residency Program Director and has a rich educational background. Her specialties include transfusion medicine, hemostasis, medical education, medical illustration, and animation. Dr.¬†Lockhart has received numerous awards and recognitions for her contributions to the field.

Dr.¬†Nicole Alyse Aqui, MD

- Memberships and Professional Organizations: Dr.¬†Aqui is a member of several professional organizations, including the College of American Pathologists, International Society of Cellular Therapy, AABB, American Society for Hematology, and the Society of Black Pathologists.

- Contact: Email
Dr.¬†Nicole Alyse Aqui is an Associate Professor of Clinical Pathology and Laboratory Medicine at the Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania. She specializes in transfusion medicine, apheresis, and blood banking. Dr.¬†Aqui has made significant contributions to her field and has been recognized with numerous awards and honors for her work.

title: University of Washington
text: Mark Kilgore, MD is the Program Director at University of Washington, located in Seattle, WA.

title: University of Washington
text:
Director Information

Dr.¬†Mark Kilgore
- Clinical and Research Background:
- Undergraduate Training: BS in Molecular and Cellular Biology at the University of Washington, Seattle, WA.
- Medical School: MD from Jefferson Medical College of Thomas Jefferson University, Philadelphia, PA.
- Post-graduate Training: Anatomic (AP) and Clinical (CP) Pathology at the University of Washington Medical Center, Seattle, WA.
- Subspecialty Training: Breast and Gynecological Pathology at the University of Washington Medical Center, Seattle, WA.
- Current Position: Junior faculty in the Department of Pathology at the University of Washington.
- Research Interests: Pathology of breast and gynecological neoplasms.
Dr.¬†Kilgore is a trained pathologist with a focus on breast and gynecological pathology. He completed his undergraduate studies in Molecular and Cellular Biology at the University of Washington and went on to obtain his medical degree from Jefferson Medical College. He pursued post-graduate training in both Anatomic and Clinical Pathology at the University of Washington Medical Center, where he also specialized in breast and gynecological pathology. Currently, he serves as junior faculty in the Department of Pathology at the University of Washington, with research interests centered on the pathology of breast and gynecological neoplasms.

title: Vanderbilt University Medical Center
text: Aaron C. Shaver, M.D., Ph.D.¬†is the Program Director at Vanderbilt University Medical Center, located in Nashville, TN.

title: Vanderbilt University Medical Center
text:
Director Information

Dr.¬†Aaron C. Shaver, Ph.D., M.D.
- Position:
- Associate Professor of Pathology, Microbiology, and Immunology
- Director, Residency Training Program
- Affiliation: Department of Pathology, Microbiology, and Immunology, Vanderbilt University Medical Center
- Location:
- MCN C-3308, 1161 21st Avenue South, Nashville, Tennessee, 37232-258
- Contact:
- Phone: 615-343-2158
- Email: aaron.shaver@vumc.org
- More Information
- Specialty: Flow cytometry, including multivariate modeling
- Background:
- Undergraduate Degree: Rice University, Houston
- Ph.D.: Molecular Evolutionary Biology, University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia
- M.D.: University of Chicago
- Residency: Pathology, Nashville
- Fellowship: Hematopathology, Nashville
- Professional Journey:
Dr.¬†Aaron Shaver is a Tennessee native. After his education, he moved to Nashville for his residency training in pathology and fellowship training in hematopathology. In 2012, he joined the faculty in the Hematopathology Division of the Department of Pathology, Microbiology, and Immunology at Vanderbilt University Medical Center.
- Interests:
- Clinical and research interests in the diagnosis and monitoring of hematologic diseases such as acute leukemia.
- Special focus on the use of clinical flow cytometry and clinical informatics.
- A long-standing interest in teaching and is involved in several medical student courses across the entire spectrum of Curriculum 2.0.
- Publications: Available on PubMed.gov
Dr.¬†Aaron C. Shaver is an Associate Professor at Vanderbilt University Medical Center with a focus on Pathology, Microbiology, and Immunology. He has a rich educational background and has made significant contributions in the field of hematopathology. Dr.¬†Shaver‚Äôs expertise lies in the diagnosis and monitoring of hematologic diseases, with a special emphasis on clinical flow cytometry and informatics. He is also deeply involved in medical education at Vanderbilt.
